parameters.text:
=You are a cyber threat intelligence assistant. 
I will provide you with an XML feed containing cybersecurity articles.

Your task:
1. Analyze the feed and extract ONLY items related to:
   - Malware
   - Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs)
   - Vulnerabilities and CVEs
   - Leaked credentials / data breaches
   - Exploits and attacks

2. For each relevant article, return only these details:
   - Published Date (UTC format if available)
   - Short Description (2â€“3 sentence summary)
   - MITRE ATT&CK Tactics & Techniques (If not specified, analyze and add)
   - Source Link

3. Output MUST be in the following strict JSON format (no markdown, no extra text):

{
  "reportDate": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "summary": [
    "âš ï¸ Key threat 1 â€¦",
    "ðŸ Key threat 2 â€¦",
    "ðŸ”’ Key threat 3 â€¦"
  ],
  "articles": [
    {
      "date": "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS UTC",
      "description": "Short summary of the article",
      "mitre": "Comma separated list of tactics/techniques OR Not Specified",
      "link": "https://original-source-link"
    }
  ]
}

IMPORTANT:
- "summary" must be an array of bullet points with relevant emojis.  
- Always output ONLY valid JSON.
- Do NOT include code fences (```json or ```).
- Do NOT include explanations, text, or commentary.
- Do NOT include markdown formatting.
- Return JSON only.

Here is the XML feed data to analyze:
{{ $json.rawData }}

=You are a Cyber Threat Intelligence assistant.

Your tasks:
1. For each selected item:
   - Visit the article URL.
   - Analyze the article text.
   - Extract ONLY relevant Indicators of Compromise (IOCs). Types: IP, Domain, URL, Email, Hashes (MD5, SHA1, SHA256), CVEs


Rules:
- Generate CSV Data with below mentioned columns: 
- type: IP, Domain, URL, Hash, Email, CVE
- value: the IOC itself
- first_seen: todayâ€™s date if missing
- source: 2â€“3 words describing the malware/campaign/actor from the article
- confidence: High / Medium / Low based on article confidence
- mitre_technique: relevant MITRE technique ID, else "N/A"
- If you found results
	Output Format (strict):
	type,value,first_seen,source,confidence,mitre_technique
- If you don't find results
	Output Format(strict):
	No Data

Here are the URLs:  {{ $json.urls }}

nodes.name: Get the result of IOC Hunt Query
Get the result of a search job

parameters.search:
| inputlookup threat_hunt_iocs.csv 
| dedup value | outputlookup threat_hunt_iocs.csv

parameters.jsCode:
const results = $input.first().json.results || []; const searchQuery = $input.first().json.splunkSearchQuery || 'index=*'; // Pass query from model // --- Case 1: No results found --- if (results.length === 0) { return [{ json: { subject: "âœ… Threat Hunt Report â€“ No IOC Matches Found", body: `

Hello Team,

The automated threat hunt workflow has completed execution against the latest data sources.

Summary:

  • No Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) were matched in the environment.
  • Sources checked: nessus, endpoint telemetry, security logs.

Action Required:

  • No immediate action is required.
  • Monitoring will continue as per the hunt schedule.

Regards,
Threat Hunting Automation System

`.trim() } }]; } // --- Case 2: Results found --- let tableRows = results.map(r => ` ${r.IOC || "-"} ${r.IOC_Type || "-"} ${r.Source || "-"} ${r.Confidence || "-"} ${r.MITRE || "-"} ${r.Matching_Hosts || "-"} ${r.SourceType || "-"} ${r.Index || "-"} `).join("\n"); const emailBody = `

Hello Team,

The automated threat hunt workflow has detected matches for known Indicators of Compromise (IOCs). Please find the details below:

${tableRows}
IOC Type Source Confidence MITRE Matching Hosts SourceType Index

Action Required:

  • Investigate the impacted host(s).
  • Review associated vulnerabilities.
  • Validate against endpoint logs, firewall data, and recent alerts.
  • Escalate to Incident Response if exploitation is confirmed.

Regards,
Threat Hunting Automation System

`.trim(); return [{ json: { subject: "ðŸš¨ Threat Hunt Alert â€“ IOC Matches Detected", body: emailBody } }];
